fields.summary: Hive Query Fail with MetaException(message:org.datanucleus.exceptions.NucleusDataStoreException: Size request failed

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When we have Metastore operations and the Metastore Database is heavily loaded or takes a long time to respond, we might run into NucleusExceptions as shown in the below stacktrace. In the below scenario, the MetastoreDB is SQL Server and the SQLServer is configured to timeout and terminate with a connection reset after 'x' seconds if it doesnt return a ResultSet. While this needs configuration change at the Metastore DB side, we need to make sure that in such cases the HMS Retrying mechanism should not provide a rigid rule to fail such hive queries. The proposed fix would be allow retries when we hit a Nucleus Exception as shown below: 

{noformat}

fields.summary: Hive RetryHMSHandler should be retrying the metastore operation in case of NucleusException

comments.body:
cc-ing [~thejas] for reviewing the change.

Thanks
Hari
[~hagleitn] This makes hive more fault tolerant. It is also a small change. I think we should try to include in 0.14 .
Also - is there a reason why we don't import the class? I can't tell from the patch.

[~hagleitn] The null scenarios are handled in the if conditions. I am using the fully qualified name and not importing NucleusExceptions because it is a one time usage within the entire RetryingHMSHandler code. If this is not preferable, I can modify the patch.

Thanks
Hari
Moving NucleusException to import as per [~hagleitn] 's comment.
